intro: Lappula botschantzevii, commonly known as the Botchanzev's lappula, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant typically grows in moist soils along riverbanks and wet meadows, thriving in temperate climates. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
